issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
{{TestEmbeddedThriftBinaryCLIService}} have showed me this behaviour.

Thrift service may hang because of this issue.
{{TestEmbeddedThriftBinaryCLIService}} can reproduce this problem with a very bad probability...but I was able to 

Its not able to aquire the semaphore; because most probably because an earlier command have produced an SQLException in the unprotected parts.
fields.summary: HiveSessionImpl#executeStatementInternal may leave locks in an inconsistent state

ATTACHMENT ID: 12833941 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

Thanks for the patch. Quick comments:

1. Moving the operation creating in the try block makes sense to me. But did you see exceptions thrown when creating a ExecuteStatementOperation? Just want to make sure we did run into this situation in reality even though it's rare.

2. nit: why did you remove "OperationManager operationManager = getOperationManager();" and call getOperationManager() instead? I don't think that's really necessary.

[~taoli-hwx]
1: i've attached a stacktrace of an affected proccess, I think this caused it.
2: there were two usages of that variable...and the other one was inside the 'catch' block...if we get there it doesnt really matter to re-get the operationManager - and this way I didn't left any method invocations outside: in the "non-protected" zone - I can put it back if you think it makes it better ;)

[~kgyrtkirk] From the stack trace, I can see a thread waiting for the semaphore. I did not see exception thrown when creating the operation. I assume you are saying the thread is blocked because of the unreleased lock caused by the bug?

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12834010/stacktrace.txt

ATTACHMENT ID: 12834010 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

You are right...I wasn't able to acquire the console output.
I'm not entirely sure what went wrong...because I don't know any method to force a maven surefire execution to abort - if I kill the process it goes down without writing the results...

But...the test I attached have reproduced the issue just by changing hiveconf values.

looks like hive-qa have tried to test the stacktrace ;)

[~vgumashta] can you take a look a these changes?

i've re-attached the original patch - the ptests are much clearer now

[~thejas] can you take a look a these changes?
